snippet: A storm on Friday set off tornadoes and severe flooding, causing widespread damage around the region and claiming at least nine victims, including two children.
abstract: Storm tears through Oklahoma, setting off tornadoes and severe flooding and causing widespread damage around region, twelve days after tornado killed 24 people and destroyed hundreds of homes in Oklahoma City; latest storm claims at least nine victims, including two children.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and MARC SANTORA
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Oklahoma City, and Marc Santora from New York. Channing Joseph contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: A storm on Friday set off tornadoes and severe flooding, causing widespread damage around the region and claiming at least nine victims, including two children.

headline.seo: Oklahoma City Area Again Hit by Deadly Weather
headline.main: Deadly Storms in Oklahoma Bring Flooding and More Tornadoes
headline.print_headline: Deadly Storms in Oklahoma Bring Flooding and More Tornadoes
